camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.mediaSize.name: camel.sink.endpoint.mediaSize
camel.sink.endpoint.mediaSize.description: Sets the stationary as defined by enumeration names in the javax.print.attribute.standard.MediaSizeName API. The default setting is to use North American Letter sized stationary. The value's case is ignored, e.g. values of iso_a4 and ISO_A4 may be used.

camel.sink.endpoint.mediaTray.name: camel.sink.endpoint.mediaTray
camel.sink.endpoint.mediaTray.description: Sets MediaTray supported by the javax.print.DocFlavor API, for example upper,middle etc.

camel.sink.endpoint.mimeType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.mimeType
camel.sink.endpoint.mimeType.description: Sets mimeTypes supported by the javax.print.DocFlavor API

camel.sink.endpoint.orientation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.orientation
camel.sink.endpoint.orientation.description: Sets the page orientation. One of: [portrait] [landscape] [reverse-portrait] [reverse-landscape]

camel.sink.endpoint.printerPrefix.name: camel.sink.endpoint.printerPrefix
camel.sink.endpoint.printerPrefix.description: Sets the prefix name of the printer, it is useful when the printer name does not start with //hostname/printer

camel.sink.endpoint.sendToPrinter.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sendToPrinter
camel.sink.endpoint.sendToPrinter.description: etting this option to false prevents sending of the print data to the printer

camel.sink.endpoint.sides.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sides
camel.sink.endpoint.sides.description: Sets one sided or two sided printing based on the javax.print.attribute.standard.Sides API One of: [one-sided] [duplex] [tumble] [two-sided-short-edge] [two-sided-long-edge]

camel.component.lpr.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.lpr.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.lpr.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.lpr.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.lpr.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.lpr.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
